Description: Three different fragments (A-C) mounted in 2 separate frames (in 2 locations): funerary text (A); last seven names from a witness list (B); four names from a witness list (C). Fragment A (mounted with fragment C) has the bottom lines of a funerary text (demotic and hieroglyphic) of Roman date, 6 ll. on recto, 1 l. on verso. Fragment C, in demotic, has on its verso a fragment from a witness list with four names, probably from a contract of Ptolemaic date. Thompson's MS Catalogue (on fragment A): "verso. 1 l. "the shrine of ..."".
Curator's comments: Fragment A has been published (recto only): M Stadler 'Papyri BM EA 10121, 10198, 10415, 10421a-b, 10426a)' in Res severa verum gaudia (Fs Zauzich; Leuven, Peeters 2004), 551-72. Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT.
Published in S. P. Vleeming, Demotic and Greek-Demotic Mummy Labels and Other Short texts gathered from Many Publications (Studia Demotica 9; Leuven: Peeters), no. 1151.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1990a / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum IV: Ptolemaic Legal Texts from the Theban Area (p.59, pl.41)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (2709) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/2709)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: delaminating Black ink (loss) Backed: brown paper Transferred to horizontal storage 27 JAN 95 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: masking tape Object Priority: B Mount Priority: C Overall Condition: C
